channel.description: Upon the 50th anniversary of the trial of legendary civil rights activist Angela Davis, and Shirley Chisholm’s historical presidential campaign, comes 1972. A seven-part historical audio drama series detailing the powerful story of Shirley Chisholm and Angela Davis, two highly respected Black women who dared to hold a mirror to the systemic racism and sexism within the United States. The show portrays the true story of two women refusing to be ignored and silenced by a society comfortable with the status quo.
channel.itunes:subtitle: The Davis Trial and the Chisholm Campaign Trail
channel.itunes:author: Yhane Washington Smith
channel.itunes:summary: Upon the 50th anniversary of the trial of legendary civil rights activist Angela Davis, and Shirley Chisholm’s historical presidential campaign, comes 1972. The show portrays the true story of two women refusing to be ignored and silenced by a society comfortable with the status quo.
channel.content:encoded: Upon the 50th anniversary of the trial of legendary civil rights activist Angela Davis, and Shirley Chisholm’s historical presidential campaign, comes 1972. A seven-part historical audio drama series detailing the powerful story of Shirley Chisholm and Angela Davis, two highly respected Black women who dared to hold a mirror to the systemic racism and sexism within the United States. The show portrays the true story of two women refusing to be ignored and silenced by a society comfortable with the status quo.

item.title: We Are the Visionaries
item.description: Content Warning: This episodes includes a depiction of police brutality. Angela Davis is held in the House of D., while Congresswoman Chisholm begins campaigning for Angela's Bail. Episode two features (in order of appearance): Jimmy Mehiel as President Richard Nixon Joshua Rubino as Edgar Hoover Jac'leen Smith as Angela Davis Ebonie Ellington as Shirley Chisholm Steven Hylton as Wesley Em Ervolina as Female Prison Guard Gabrielle Adkins as Margaret Burnham Victoria Leigh - as College Student Ian Bell as Male Prison Guard Chanters: Naomi Smith, Clarissa Lynn, Julie Atwell, Jesse Miel- Baldorama, Nina Smith Sound Design by Xperience J. Sound Engineer and Producer - T.H. Ponders Art by Neville Harvey Written, directed and edited by Yhane Washington Smith Support the show by purchasing an Angela Davis and/or Shirley Chisholm notebook! Go to Blackbirdletterpress.com Thank you!

Angela Davis is held in the House of D., while Congresswoman Chisholm begins campaigning for Angela's Bail. item.content:encoded:
Content Warning: This episodes includes a depiction of police brutality.

Angela Davis is held in the House of D., while Congresswoman Chisholm begins campaigning for Angela's Bail.

Episode two features (in order of appearance):

Jimmy Mehiel as President Richard Nixon

Joshua Rubino as Edgar Hoover

Jac'leen Smith as Angela Davis

Ebonie Ellington as Shirley Chisholm

Steven Hylton as Wesley

Em Ervolina as Female Prison Guard

Gabrielle Adkins as Margaret Burnham

Victoria Leigh - as College Student

Ian Bell as Male Prison Guard

Chanters: Naomi Smith, Clarissa Lynn, Julie Atwell, Jesse Miel- Baldorama, Nina Smith

Sound Design by Xperience J.

Sound Engineer and Producer - T.H. Ponders

Art by Neville Harvey

Written, directed and edited by Yhane Washington Smith

Support the show by purchasing an Angela Davis and/or Shirley Chisholm notebook! Go to Blackbirdletterpress.com

Thank you!

item.title: We Are the Revolutionaries
item.description: Content Warning: This episode includes a depiction of police gun violence. We hear the powerful voices of Angela Davis and Shirley Chisholm, the two women who launched a national and international movement of liberation. We witness the series of events that causes Davis to flee California. Featuring in order of appearance: T.H. Ponders Ebonie Ellington as Shirley Chisholm, Emilio Smith as Jonathan Jackson, Jac'leen Smith as Angela Davis, Tom Smith, Isaiah Mueller as McClain and Conrad Chisholm, Jordan Stillman, Nina Smith, Shawn Regruto, Peter Kiley as Governor Ronald Reagan, Joshua Rubino as Edgar Hoover, Michael Minard as News Reporter, Jeanette Berry as Fania Davis, Steven Hylton as David, D. Rubin Green as the Congressman, Jimmy Mehiel as President Nixon., Sound Design by Xperience J., Editor, Producer, Sound Recording Engineer - T.H. Ponders, Art by Neville Harvey Written and directed by Yhane Washington Smith Support the show by purchasing an Angela Davis and/or Shirley Chisholm notebook! Go to Blackbirdletterpress.com Thank you!

item.content:encoded:
Content Warning: This episode includes a depiction of police gun violence.

We hear the powerful voices of Angela Davis and Shirley Chisholm, the two women who launched a national and international movement of liberation. We witness the series of events that causes Davis to flee California.

Featuring in order of appearance:

T.H. Ponders

Ebonie Ellington as Shirley Chisholm,

Emilio Smith as Jonathan Jackson,

Jac'leen Smith as Angela Davis,

Tom Smith,

Isaiah Mueller as McClain and Conrad Chisholm,

Jordan Stillman,

Nina Smith,

Shawn Regruto,

Peter Kiley as Governor Ronald Reagan,

Joshua Rubino as Edgar Hoover,

Michael Minard as News Reporter,

Jeanette Berry as Fania Davis,

Steven Hylton as David,

D. Rubin Green as the Congressman,

Jimmy Mehiel as President Nixon.,

Sound Design by Xperience J.,

Editor, Producer, Sound Recording Engineer - T.H. Ponders,

Art by Neville Harvey

Written and directed by Yhane Washington Smith

Support the show by purchasing an Angela Davis and/or Shirley Chisholm notebook! Go to Blackbirdletterpress.com

Thank you!

item.title: 1972 Trailer
item.description: Upon the 50th anniversary of the trial of legendary civil rights activist Angela Davis, and Shirley Chisholm’s historical presidential campaign, comes 1972. A seven-part historical audio drama series detailing the powerful story of Shirley Chisholm and Angela Davis, two highly respected Black women who dared to hold a mirror to the systemic racism and sexism within the United States. The show portrays the often overlooked true story of two women refusing to be ignored and silenced by a society comfortable with the status quo.

A seven-part historical audio drama series detailing the powerful story of Shirley Chisholm and Angela Davis, two highly respected Black women who dared to hold a mirror to the systemic racism and sexism within the United States. The show portrays the often overlooked true story of two women refusing to be ignored and silenced by a society comfortable with the status quo.
